Description: Redware pottery canopic jar of Wahka decorated with low relief representation of human arms holding ankh and was-sceptres; column of Hieroglyphic text; no lid.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Possibly from the tomb of the similarly named nomarch at Qau el-Kebir?
Curator's comments: Photo: Taylor, Death and the Afterlife, 68 Mentions: Kettel, CdE 62 (1987), 182--in a review, mentions another jar of ?same man? in Petrie Mus, UC 16125, and says it is not clearly associated with Qau. Dodson, Canopic equipment, 18, n. 12
